_meanings:
<ab>N.</ab> of a demon killed by
Kārtikeya. [He was the son of 
Vajrānga and Varāṅgī. He propitiated the
god Brahmadeva by means of his 
penance on the Pāriyātra mountain, and 
asked as a boon that he should not be 
killed by any one except a child seven days
old. On the strength of this boon he
began to oppress the gods who were 
obliged to go to Brahmā and ask his 
assistance in the destruction of the demon;
(see <ls>Ku. 2</ls>). But they were told that
the offspring of Śiva could alone 
vanquish him. Afterwards Kārtikeya was
born, and he slew the demon on the
seventh day of his birth].

an epithet of 
Kārtikeya. (For other senses, see under {#tF#}).
